oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Interview with Āminah ‘Abd al-Ghanī
مقابلة مع آمنة عبد الغني
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Short stories, Arabic--Palestine
Stupidity--Anecdotes

Kings and rulers--Fiction
oai_dc:dc.dc:otherSubject: Chickens; Childlessness; Dispersion; Emotions; Engagement; Fishermen; Girls; Jewels; Kings; Loved ones; Lullabies; Magic; Muḥammad, Prophet, 571-633; Princes; Queens; Stupidity; Travel; Wisdom; al-Shāṭir Muḥammad; Building practices; Chickens; Childbirth; Childlessness; Death; Economic prosperity; Food; God's will; Hunting; Imprisonment; Jinn; Kings; Living conditions; Loggers; Magic object; Marriage; Money; Mothers-in-law; Shaykhs; Superstition; Vows; Wives; Akka (Palestine); Brothers; Child killings; Childbirth; Children; Chores; Cousins; Diseases; Dowry; Enemies; Exile; Homecoming; Hospitality; Hunting; Hyenas; Inheritance; Injuries; Leaving; Loved ones; Magic; Marital Abandonment; Marriage; Medical care; Princes; Shepherds; Travel; Wedding songs; ʻAtābā; Arranged marriage; Betrayal; Childbirth; Conduct of life; Dhabīḥah; Disguise; Engagement; Leaving; Living conditions; Magic; Magic object; Marital Abandonment; Money; Peasant workers; Peasants; Princes; Qarīnah; Riddles; Secrets; Sit Bdūr; Snakes; Trees; Wedding celebration; Wives
oai_dc:dc.dc:biography: The interview was recorded on April 20, 1997 with Āminah ‘Abd al-Ghanī, female, born in 1912 in al-Sumayrīyah, Palestine and resides in ʻAyn al-Ḥilwah Palestinian Refugee Camp, Lebanon.
oai_dc:dc.dc:biographyAR: سجلت المقابلة مع آمنة عبد الغني في 20 نيسان ابريل عام 1997، أنثى، ولدت عام 1912 في السُمَيريّة، فلسطين. تقيم في مخيم عين الحلوة للاجئين الفلسطينيين، لبنان.
